intro: Kickxia glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, simple, and somewhat succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh habitat.
